contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=February 2013}} In the ancient [[Japan]]ese government, '''''Nairan''''' (内覧) was the inspection of documents submitted to the ''[[Emperor of Japan|Tennō]]'' (Emperor), or the position held by those who performed the inspection.<ref>{{cite book|last=Goble|first=Andrew|title=Kenmu: Go-Daigo's Revolution|year=1996|publisher=Harvard University Press|isbn=0-674-50255-8|pages=41|url=http://books.google.com/books?id=K9fBsIFIjLoC}}</ref> The ''Tennō'' usually gave a ''Nairan no Senji'' (内覧の宣旨), or an Imperial edict of inspection, to the regent, also known as ''[[Sessho and Kampaku|Sessho]]'' or ''[[Sessho and Kampaku|Kampaku]]''. ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Classical Japan]] {{Japan-hist-stub}}
